image.altText: Two women walk with armed guards

items.synopsis: A mother and daughter from the US become the first of about 200 hostages to be released by Islamist group Hamas, who were kidnapped in its attack on south Israel earlier this month.

title.children: Hamas releases American mother and daughter kidnapped during deadly attack, Israel says

image.altText: Image of rockets fired from Gaza

items.synopsis: US President Joe Biden says he thinks Hamas’ initial attack on Israel was tied in part to efforts to normalise relations between Israel and Saudi Arabia.

title.children: Biden says Hamas attacked Israel in part to halt normalisation with Saudi Arabia

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) has updated its travel advice for Australians regarding the West Bank. The government's Smartraveller service now advises: "Do not travel to the West Bank (excluding East Jerusalem) due to the volatile security situation." DFAT says it still advises Australians to "reconsider your need to travel to Israel and the Occupied Palestinian Territories overall and do not travel to Gaza, border areas with Gaza and border areas with Lebanon".
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Government advises Australians not to travel to the West Bank

children.content: The Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) has updated its travel advice for Australians regarding the West Bank.
The government's Smartraveller service now advises: "Do not travel to the West Bank (excluding East Jerusalem) due to the volatile security situation."

DFAT says it still advises Australians to "reconsider your need to travel to Israel and the Occupied Palestinian Territories overall and do not travel to Gaza, border areas with Gaza and border areas with Lebanon".

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Reporting by Courtney Barett-Peters Thousands of people have gathered at Sydney's Town Hall in preparation to march through the CBD. Led by the Palestinian Action Group, dozens of people are chanting "free free Palestine" and "Palestine will never die". Organisers told the crowd to be "disciplined" and that anti-Semitic chants, the lighting of flares or burning of flags would not be tolerated. Young children and older people alike are waving Palestinian flags and holding placards with words and photographs in support of Gaza. Organisers of the protest are criticising the federal government, claiming it has failed to support Palestinians and other Indigenous people around the world. The protest was authorised late on Friday, after a week of controversy following previous rallies resulting in some arrests.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Thousands gather in Sydney in solidarity with Palestinians

children.content: Thousands of people have gathered at Sydney's Town Hall in preparation to march through the CBD.
Led by the Palestinian Action Group, dozens of people are chanting "free free Palestine" and "Palestine will never die".

props.alt: People carrying Palestinian flags and holding protest signs march on a street

children.content: Organisers told the crowd to be "disciplined" and that anti-Semitic chants, the lighting of flares or burning of flags would not be tolerated.
Young children and older people alike are waving Palestinian flags and holding placards with words and photographs in support of Gaza.
Organisers of the protest are criticising the federal government, claiming it has failed to support Palestinians and other Indigenous people around the world.
The protest was authorised late on Friday, after a week of controversy following previous rallies resulting in some arrests.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Uri Raanan says he learned of his daughter and ex-wife's release from photos on television. "I did not get a phone call," he said. "First of all, I got a lot of pictures from the TV in Israel. They showed the release of them. "And later I got a phone call from the IDF they told me they were going to meet them and that they were going to call me." He added he had spoken to his daughter since the release. "I have been glued to the TV for two weeks, hoping for good news. Finally it came through."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Father learned of hostage release 'from the TV'

children.content: Uri Raanan says he learned of his daughter and ex-wife's release from photos on television.
"I did not get a phone call," he said.
"First of all, I got a lot of pictures from the TV in Israel. They showed the release of them.
"And later I got a phone call from the IDF they told me they were going to meet them and that they were going to call me."
He added he had spoken to his daughter since the release.
"I have been glued to the TV for two weeks, hoping for good news. Finally it came through."
